line_1: Which in some hour, retired and lone,
line_2: Thine eyes may sometimes look upon,

line_1: To thee yon Abbey dank, and lone,
line_2: Where Ivy chains each mould'ring stone

line_1: Yea; and to many a wight, bereft and lone,
line_2: In musing hours, though all to thee unknown,

line_1: O no! our traveller, still and lone,
line_2: A far, fatiguing way hath gone;
